title: Topological data analysis on noisy quantum computers
abstract: arXiv:2209.09371v4 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: Topological data analysis (TDA) is a powerful technique for extracting complex and valuable shape-related summaries of high-dimensional data. However, the computational demands of classical algorithms for computing TDA are exorbitant, and quickly become impractical for high-order characteristics. Quantum computers offer the potential of achieving significant speedup for certain computational problems. Indeed, TDA has been purported to be one such problem, yet, quantum computing algorithms proposed for the problem, such as the original Quantum TDA (QTDA) formulation by Lloyd, Garnerone and Zanardi, require fault-tolerance qualifications that are currently unavailable. In this study, we present NISQ-TDA, a fully implemented end-to-end quantum machine learning algorithm needing only a short circuit-depth, that is applicable to high-dimensional classical data, and with provable asymptotic speedup for certain classes of problems. Th

Title: Topological data analysis on noisy quantum computers
Abstract: arXiv:2209.09371v4 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: Topological data analysis (TDA) is a powerful technique for extracting complex and valuable shape-related summaries of high-dimensional data. However, the computational demands of classical algorithms for computing TDA are exorbitant, and quickly become impractical for high-order characteristics. Quantum computers offer the potential of achieving significant speedup for certain computational problems. Indeed, TDA has been purported to be one such problem, yet, quantum computing algorithms proposed for the problem, such as the original Quantum TDA (QTDA) formulation by Lloyd, Garnerone and Zanardi, require fault-tolerance qualifications that are currently unavailable. In this study, we present NISQ-TDA, a fully implemented end-to-end quantum machine learning algorithm needing only a short circuit-depth, that is applicable to high-dimensional classical data, and with provable asymptotic speedup for certain classes of problems. translated_title: 嘈杂量子计算上的拓扑数据分析
translated_abstract: 拓扑数据分析(TDA)是一种强大的技术，用于提取高维数据的复杂和有价值的与形状相关的摘要。然而，用于计算TDA的经典算法的计算需求是巨大的，对于高阶特征很快变得不切实际。量子计算机有望在某些计算问题上实现显著加速。实际上，TDA被认为是这类问题之一，然而，为该问题提出的量子计算算法，比如Lloyd、Garnerone和Zanardi提出的最初的量子TDA(QTDA)公式，需要目前不可用的容错资格。在本研究中，我们提出了NISQ-TDA，这是一个完全实现的端到端量子机器学习算法，只需要较短的电路深度，适用于高维经典数据，并对某些类别的问题具有可证明的渐近加速。
tldr: 本研究提出了NISQ-TDA，是一个端到端量子机器学习算法，可用于高维经典数据，并对某些问题具有可证明的渐近加速。
en_tdlr: This study introduces NISQ-TDA, a quantum machine learning algorithm that is applicable to high-dimensional classical data and provides provable asymptotic speedup for certain problems.
